relating to or using metonymy (= referring to something using a word that describes one of its qualities or features): Names based on occupation are known as metonymic names. Her violin stands for her in a metonymic sense. See
metonymy
More examplesFewer examplesThere might be less creativity in metonymic language use than the authors assume.“From the cradle to the grave” is a metonymic expression that represents two abstract terms, birth and death, with two (concrete) symbols.Her poetry produces a metonymic web of association.
